project.teaser: The aim of BIOBUILD project is to develop and demonstrate fully bio-based building materials with thermal storage function that can replace high environmental footprint products. Our solution demonstrates functional incorporation of bio-based phase change materials (bioPCMs)...
project.objective: The aim of BIOBUILD project is to develop and demonstrate fully bio-based building materials with thermal storage function that can replace high environmental footprint products. Our solution demonstrates functional incorporation of bio-based phase change materials (bioPCMs) into solid wood and wood fibres bound by plant oil resins, lignin, or fungal mycelia to produce novel bio-composite building materials with significantly improved thermal properties. The novel materials possess a high multifunctional performance, meet requirements for sustainable “green” production, and ensure end-of-life options and recycling. Environmental and social impacts and benefits are fully integrated into the life-cycle perspective.
project.title: Innovative bio-based building materials with thermal energy storage function
project.keywords: Bio-based phase change materials, bio-binders, bio-composites, energy storage, fungal mycelia, building materials, lignin, parquet, plant oil resins, solid wood, wallboards, wood fibres

article.title: Environmentally friendly building materials with thermal energy storage properties

result.title: Specific climate considerations and building typological classification
result.description: Content of report: Definition of the building typologies and the climatic zones where BIOBUILD concept can be integrated. Data from the EU standards Directive (i.e. Directive (EU) 2018/844), literature, and EU projects will be used to identify the building requirements and identify reference-building typologies for residential and not residential sector in Europe. The outcome of this task will be used as a base for the simulations to prove the replicability of BIOBUILD concept and for the activity related to LCA and integration studies.The report is linked to T1.1.

details.publisher: International Research Group on Wood Protection

result.title: Technical, market codes, and certification strategies
result.description: Content of report: A summary of existing national and/or local regulatory framework that could support the market development setting the basic requirements of BIOBUILD concept. It is based on a review of the European and national certification standards, technical and marked codes of the EU countries to support the activities related to standardization and business development. Possible barriers encountered in the market deployment will be identified. An operative analysis will be conducted to follow the identified standards to obtain the required certifications (i.e., CE standards) in the design and production process.The report is linked to T1.2 and T1.3.

result.title: Enzymatisch polymerisiertes Lignosulfonat als biobasierter Kleber für Biokomposite
Definition and selection of KPIs
result.description: Content of report: Selection of proper KPIs is fundamental to allow the performance assessment of BIOBUILD concept under various aspects. Performance indicators (PIs) will be selected based on a literature analysis of KPIs defined for the built environment. Technical, economic and environmental PIs will be outlined.The report is linked to T1.4.

category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/waste management/waste treatment processes/recycling

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
